indicator_name: Availability of public resources' monitoring and allocation systems for gender equality and women's empowerment
national_indicator_available: 5.c.1.1  Availability of public resources' monitoring and allocation systems for gender equality and women's empowerment
computation_definitions:
The indicator measures three criteria: I) the intention of the government to tackle gender equality and women empowerment (GEWE) by confirming the availability of programs / policies and allocation of resources to promote GEWE;
II) availability of planning and budgetary tools to follow the resources for GEWE all over the public finance management cycle; iii) transparency in making pubic the information about the resources allocated for promoting GEWE.
The country will meet criterion 1 (if it has 2 YES out of the 3 questions of criterion 1)
The country will meet criterion 2 (if it has 4 YES out of 7 questions of criterion 2)
The country will meet criterion 3 (if it has 2 YES out of 3 questions of criterion 3).
Depending the scores per criterion, the country will get one of the qualifications "requirements are met totally", "requirements are partially met" and "requirements are not met".
Indicator is reported in the context of indicator 17.16.1
